value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: Power BI Desktop: How to find the native query after query folding
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to find the native query in Power BI Desktop after query folding does its thing? Do you even know what query folding is? In this video, Adam looks at how you can find the query that will be sent to your data source and a few things to be aware of. This applies to Power Query in

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. He also looks at how to work with expressions and formatting.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Sort By A Measure Not Shown In Visual
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Patrick shows you how you can sort by a measure not show in a visual within Power BI Desktop. This was something we didn't even know about until recently and it a great little Power BI nugget. If you wanted to sort by something not shown in a visual, this video is for you!

value.title: Power BI XMLA Endpoint: Why you should care
value.excerpt: The XMLA Endpoint in Power BI can be very powerful. Adam looks at what it is and how to get started with it. If you are using Power BI Premium or Premium Per User, you need to know about this! value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI! value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can display multiple values within a tooltip for a visual. He walks through the DAX measure and also shows some pitfalls to look out for when it comes to filter context.  Go here for the sample DAX statement: https://guyinacube.com/2017/06/tooltips-tooltips-tooltips-power-bi/

value.title: Tracing with Log Analytics and Power BI
value.excerpt: With Log Analytics integration in Power BI, you can now capture Analysis Services trace events easily and over a longer period of time. Combined with the Power BI template report, you can gain a lot of insights into usage of your datasets. With more to come down the road!  Announcing long-term usage
